briefdescription.para: the ImgLabel class is a friend of Qcorr in order to make all members of Qcorr accessible by an ImgLabel object
allows to modify parameters for the correlation operations, such as template size and scan interval. This class is a friend of Qcorr.
the resulting x-coordinate match obtained from correlation of a template against a target
the resulting y-coordinate match obtained from correlation of a template against a target
Dialog Box to choose a correlation method.
Dialog Box to modify correlation parameters such as template size and scan interval.
String that saves the path for the first file image that has been loaded.
Left Panel's Image (a.k.a. "reference image" when performing template matching through correlation).
Right Panel's Image (a.k.a "target image").
Template Image that is selected from the reference image (in the left panel) that will be matched against.
Correlation Map resulting from the Template Matching action.
Disparity Map that results from the pixel disparities found between the left and right images.
label used to display the left image. This is sub-classed widget implemented with the functionality of allowing template selection by a rectangular rubber-band
a sub-classed label widget implemented with the purpose of displaying the target image in the right panel with added functionality such as the visualization of the found match
status label that updates the mouse-pointer's position coordinates as it moves and selects templates. It also provides other types of information when required.
8-bit gray-scale color table
8-bit green-scale color table
upper-left corner point where the correlation match was found
the current template's size as a QSize object
group of menu actions for the mode of operation.
A dialogue to stop the current correlation process.
indicates that an image is loaded in the left panel
indicates that an image is loaded in the right panel
indicates that a correlation map exists
indicates that a disparity map exists
emergency stop for the
interval of scan traversal by the template
Constructor of the Qcorr class.
Destructor: House keeping that should be done when the Qcorr main window is closed -- specifically, it closes the controlsWindow;.
Q_SLOT that closes the main Qcorr window and the controls Window;.
Q_SLOT that shows the controls window and raises it to the foreground if already open.
Q_SLOT that allows to browse and load an image on the left panel.
Q_SLOT that allows to browse and load an image on the right panel.
Q_SLOT used to change the mouse pointer according to the current operation mode.
Q_SLOT that selectively provides the appropriate existent map of results from correlation (template matching) or pixel disparity.
Q_SLOT that starts the chosen operation according to the mode chosen, either template matching or disparity finder.
Q_SLOT triggers the flag to abort the current operation.
Displays any QImage on a Qlabel.

parameterdescription.para: boolean flag to enable or disable the operation mode's actions widgets as well as the related widgets such as, start_pushButton and controls_pushButton

briefdescription.para: Instantiates label widgets and initializes other member variables pertinent to the overall GUI functionality of the main window itself.
emergency stop to abort the disparity operation process

Performs template matching through correlation of the selected template against the target image. It calls findCorrelation() with the appropriate parameters to do a single template correlation across the entire target image.

Pixel-disparity finding operation. It should be mainly be used with stereo images that can get correlated row-by-row by using findCorrelation() with the pertinent parameters and the appropriate Q_SLOT function implementation.

memberdef.argsstring: (const unsigned char *imgTarget, const int nWI, const int nHI, const int nDepthI, const unsigned char *imgTemplate, const int nWT, const int nHT, const int nDepthT, int &rnDx, int &rnDy, int nMethod, bool bMultires=false, int nInitialXPosition=0, int nInitialYPosition=0, int nNumberOfRows=0)
memberdef.name: findCorrelation

briefdescription.para: Cross-correlation of target image with template image.

simplesect.para: Correlation is performed on gray-scale (1 channel image) that are computed in this procedure through the convertToGrayScaleFloat() function.

parameterdescription.para: Buffer of unsigned characters containing the target image where correlation match is to be found
Width of target image
Height of target image
Pixel depth of target image
Buffer of unsigned characters containing the template image
Width of target image
Height of target image
Pixel depth of target image
x-coordinate where the highest level of correlation match is found (top-left corner of the match)
y-coordinate where the highest level of correlation match is found (top-left corner of the match)

Determines the selected method to be used in the correlation process. The method is a globally defined enumeration. The available methods are:
CROSS_CORR (cross correlation): \[ C(u,v) = \frac {\sum{\left\{T(x,y) * I(x-u,y-v)\right\}}} {\sqrt{ \sum{I(x-u,y-v)^2}}} \]
SUM_SQ_DIFF (sum of squared differences): \[ C(u,v) = \frac {\sum{\left\{T(x,y)-I(x-u,y-v)\right\}^2}} {\sqrt{\sum{I(x-u,y-v)^2}}} \]
CORR_COEFF (correlation coefficient): \[ C(u,v) = \frac {\sum{\left\{(T(x,y)-T_{avg}) * (I(x-u,y-v)-I_{avg})\right\}}} {\sqrt{\sum{(T(x,y)-T_{avg})^2} * \sum{(I(x-u,y-v)-I_{avg})^2}}} \] Remark: The square root of the sum of the squares (RSS) is being used to calculate the aggregate accuracy of a measurement when the accuracies of the all the measuring devices are known. The average accuracy is not merely the arithmetic average of the accuracies (or uncertainties), nor is it the sum of them. Note how the RSS result in this case is greater than the largest of the values under the radical.
Determines if multiresolution correlation should be applied, by making use of image pyramids. With multiresoltion, the correlation can be determined faster than direct correlation. Default is false.
Indicates the x-coordinate of the pixel on the target image where correlation should start. Default is 0
Indicates the y-coordinate of the pixel on the target image where correlation should start. Default is 0
Indicates the number of rows on the target image to be scanned. Default is 0, which means all of them.

simplesect.para: a float array resulting from the conversion of the source image into an 8-bit gray-scale image.

memberdef.argsstring: (const unsigned char *pchImgOriginalBits, int nSize, int nDepth)

briefdescription.para: Cast images to an 8-bit gray-scale channel of type float.

Number of pixels in the source image
Pixel depth of the source image

simplesect.para: the correlation number computed by method (directly). Additionally, the (dx,dy) offset of the template for which there exists a best match.

Used for testing and investing the bits stored in QImages or other Qt Widgets.

briefdescription.para: A Digital Image Correlation Program (Template Matcher and Pixel Disparity Mapping) implemented in QT4.

detaileddescription.para: This class combines all other sub-classed QWidgets implemented throughout the program. The main correlation (template matching) functionality is implemented in this class through the procedure convertToGrayScaleFloat()

simplesect.para: Correlation is performed on gray-scale (1 channel image) that are computed in this procedure through the convertToGrayScaleFloat() function.

Use pyramids method for faster correlation
Spacebar opens full screen mode on image.
